column5: Posting here ,since the classifieds seems mumbo jumbo to me. Looking for one of those small out boards like a 1.2-1.4  hp. 80,s era or above. Reasonable price.
So. Trying to keep up with me. Lol. Hope you find one
Terry,  he doesn't want  to pull you anymore!
lol  i have an outboard on mine they are nice for longer runs or if the misfish  wants to water ski
Brian I have seen them on Facebook marketplace and the buy/sell groups.  I'll get links to you next time I come across them.  Michael

Here's a few, they're all 2hp though. https://www.facebook.com/marketplace/item/977800692412491/ https://www.facebook.com/marketplace/item/564456504061531/ https://www.facebook.com/marketplace/item/822811591438767/ Michael
I say you strap a 25 to the back, paint it red and call it the Misfish Budweiser!!!
Almost looks like that would be the right size.   Matter of fact they actually make kits for string trimmers.
so I see ?
Watched a video of one. I would go deaf in 2 hours.LOL They are cool.
Check with Bernie Gieslier he might have one hanging around. Art
Thanks Art. Have not seen him around here in years. I,ll contact one of the rat pack fellas and see if I can get a hold of him.
He on Facebook,  every time he  gets home from working the mine  I think it’s two weeks on two weeks off or something like that
I dont do FB, you know that.
He working for DeBeers in the mines?
Yup
Go ahead and write him a note here with a contact number  and I will leave him a message on FB to check in with you Brian. Art

Hello Brian. Just got home yesterday. 	I have a small 2HP Evinrude, but I think I will hang on to it as they are getting harder to find a good one. I'll check over at the shop to see if they have anything around.
Even those girls aren’t going to help sell those things.  Five minutes and I’d be chucking the thing in the water.
Hey Bernie,good to hear from you. Thanks a bunch
I have a 40 hp mariner longshaft you could use. Runs mint, just has no reverse!  S.
Brian's never going back anyhow... so forward is just fine!
I have a yammy 4hp  2 stroke that I am considering selling or trading for a bigger motor in the 9.9 range?

4hp  is a bit too heavy Pete.  Between the battery and the electric,I am at 60 pounds. It,s not that it,s too heavy,it that I am charging the battery,lugging it. Having a light small gas motor would be nice to just fill and go.
